body:
_From @dsolodow on January 11, 2018 2:37_

From: https://github.com/PowerShell/vscode-powershell/issues/1104

VSCode on Windows, PSCore on Ubuntu.
Get-Help shows fine. but running say:
```powershell
help get-command
```
Shows a BOM character at the start of the help data.

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body:
Copied this over from the PowerShell-Docs repo, I still maintain that our `help` function should just be an alias to `Get-Help`, regardless of whether we change `Get-Help` to support paging by default. 

To summarize this issue, though: a BOM is showing up when you use `help`. It doesn't show up when you `Get-Help`. We should fix it. :)

title: `help` function should not inject a BOM at the top of the help content
